definitions.text: a fence formed by a row of closely planted shrubs or bushes
any technique designed to reduce or eliminate financial risk; for example, taking two positions that will offset each other if prices change
an intentionally noncommittal or ambiguous statement
examples: when you say `maybe' you are just hedging

definitions.text: avoid or try to avoid fulfilling, answering, or performing (duties, questions, or issues)
examples: They tend to evade their responsibilities

definitions.text: hinder or restrict with or as if with a hedge
enclose or bound in with or as it with a hedge or hedges

examples: diversify your financial portfolio to hedge price risks
